page.title: 07SOUTHLANDS FARM CHELMSFORD
page.content: Southlands Farm has exactly 156 acres of land. The farmer's wife has traced the farm back to 1746, and it goes back even further than the original Domesday Book itself. They grow peas, oats, wheat and barley. The peas are harvested first of all, at the beginning of July. The barley is harvested in the middle of July and the wheat in August. Their crops are sold to whichever corn merchant will give them the best price. The farmer has many large barns.The largest is the grain store. There is one open barn in which all the straw from the wheat and barley fields is kept.
